conclusion: Need to analyze the x-t graph to determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second.
The graph shows that the car's position at the end of the 2nd second is 10 meters.
The speed of the car is given by the slope of the line on the graph.
The slope of the line represents the car's speed.
The slope of the line is calculated as the change in position (x) divided by the change in time (t).
From the graph, the car's position at the end of the 2nd second is 10 meters.
The change in position (x) is 10 meters.
The change in time (t) is 2 seconds.
The speed (v) is calculated as v = Δx/Δt = 10 m/2 s = 5 m/s.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 meters per second.
